ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a great deal about the processes behind water treatment. I am now able to engage in conversations regarding these mechanisms and the plants that deliver clean drinking water to individuals and cities. I was able to sharpen my math and critical thinking skills and apply what I learned to real-life scenarios.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course was well designed and engaging.

While I felt the course was extremely valuable and important at this stage in my academic career, there were a few structural portions of the class that could be optimized. Having to print out the note slides made it hard to take in some of what was being taught, and only in rewriting my notes a second or third time helped to solidify what I had learned. Additionally, I really struggled with having problem sets due the Tuesday before the two first Thursday exams. The close proximity of these events plus not receiving feedback on the assignments before the exam shortened the adequate time I felt I had to prepare for the exams. I did appreciate the way in which the notes were given though, as the walkthroughs from equations and diagrams were extremely detailed and descriptive.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student. I think I had expected further discussion on membranes before learning that the class had been split off from this curriculum. However, I think the mixture of the teaching and the overall subject matter are important for potential careers in environmental engineering. And while this course was extremely heavy on mass balance and math, the connections to municipal water treatment helps provide context and gives a greater understanding of how society functions.
